metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7522 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
OpenVPN versions before 2.4.3 and before 2.3.17 are vulnerable to denial-of-service by authenticated remote attacker via sending a certificate with an embedded NULL character.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7522` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

openvpn - 2.3.2-7ubuntu3.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> introduced in 2.4 in Debian/Ubuntu, package is built with openssl

criterions.comment: openvpn package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.3.2-7ubuntu3.1').
